A National Loan Policy for Scientific Serials .A Urquhart, D.J. Bunn, R.M. Elsewhere (1) a survey has been reported of the use of the serials in the Science Museum Library.  In brief this showed that where the Science Museum Library's copy of a serial was frequently used, this serial was widely held, and that the converse was true.  In fact it appears that the use of the Science Museum's copy of a periodical is a rough measure of the national loan use of library copies. .X 4	1	766 5	1	766 33	1	766 36	1	766 41	1	766 76	1	766 89	2	766 97	1	766 102	1	766 111	1	766 112	1	766 163	1	766 183	2	766 184	2	766 193	2	766 198	1	766 199	1	766 201	1	766 203	1	766 204	1	766 207	1	766 210	1	766 225	1	766 245	1	766 269	1	766 364	1	766 373	1	766 545	1	766 552	2	766 587	1	766 605	1	766 613	1	766 614	1	766 638	1	766 735	2	766 747	1	766 750	1	766 753	1	766 766	5	766 767	1	766 775	1	766 782	1	766 784	2	766 788	1	766 789	1	766 793	1	766 800	1	766 808	1	766 811	1	766 816	1	766 828	1	766 905	1	766 925	2	766 953	1	766 959	1	766 960	1	766 961	1	766 962	1	766 964	1	766 977	1	766 983	1	766 1016	1	766 1023	1	766 1030	1	766 1055	2	766 1087	1	766 1090	1	766 1135	1	766 1253	1	766 1260	1	766 1275	1	766 1276	1	766 1278	1	766 1280	1	766 1285	1	766 1286	1	766 1287	1	766 1302	1	766 1335	1	766 1390	1	766 1397	2	766 1400	1	766 1417	1	766 1428	1	766 1432	2	766 1432	2	766
